circumstances: Brian Porter had a history of disappearing without notice, occasionally causing worry among his family. On this occasion, he was reported missing after a night out. Earlier, Brian was last seen near Lochies Road, Burntisland, where he had spent the afternoon skateboarding with his brother. Brian missed work with no contact, a concerning pattern of behavior not unnoticed by his grandmother. The young boy was traced by the police two days later at 7 Pitreavie Court, Dunfermline. Brian's absence had once again highlighted the unpredictable nature of his outings and the challenges his family faced in managing his sudden disappearances.

circumstances: Brian Porter, a 13-year-old boy, was reported missing after last being seen at a skate park in North Queensferry. Known to have been experiencing an identity crisis, concerns were raised by friend Gary Kay when Brian failed to return home. It's believed Brian took his bicycle from the skate park, possibly en route to visit Kathryn Wallis, a close friend residing in the area. Brian has shown interest in rehab centers, having discussed them with his grandfather previously. Days later, while a search was underway including an investigation of vehicle-related areas, he was found by police being reunited with a friend near a sports club on Castlandhill Road, Rosyth, safe and unharmed.

His mother reported that he had ongoing concerns over addiction, potentially from influences outside of the home, and was scheduled to attend regular sessions at a rehab center.
